One of the most unique psycho-thrillers in years centres on Spanish star Luis Tosar, who delivers a sensationally disturbing performance as CÃƒÂ©sar, a Barcelona janitor fixated with the new tenant at an upscale apartment block. Director Jaume BalaguerÃƒÂ³ co-directed [Rec], and the setting here is similar, but there's also a nod to the work of Roman Polanski in a provocative and intense tale of obsession. At night when Clara (played by Marta Etura, Tosar's real-life partner) is fast asleep, CÃƒÂ©sar sneaks into her flat - and into her bed - to feed his deranged fantasies. He intends to make her life a complete misery and woe betide anyone who threatens his meticulously laid-out master plan. The unusually plotted chills and a series of twists that spiral into chaos put BalaguerÃƒÂ³'s creep-fest on the Hitchcockian side of dread. It's dark and unsettling, and the gradual build-up of suspense is of such a startling calibre that it will have you biting your nails to the quick.

A deranged janitor insinuates himself into the life of one of his tenants with horrifying and traumatic results.
